title: Normal probability interval for zucchini weights

content.question: Zucchini weights are approximately normally distributed with mean 0.8 pound and standard deviation 0.25 pound. Which of the following shaded regions best represents the probability that a randomly selected zucchini will weigh between 0.55 pound and 1.3 pounds?

choices.label: From left to right, the value at the third tickmark is labeled mu minus sigma, the value at the fourth tickmark is labeled mu, and the value at the sixth tickmark is labeled mu plus two sigma. The area below the graph of the curve, above the horizontal axis, and between the values mu minus sigma and mu plus two sigma is shaded.

From left to right, the value at the third tickmark is labeled mu minus sigma, the value at the fourth tickmark is labeled mu, and the value at the seventh tickmark is labeled mu plus three sigma. The area below the graph of the curve, above the horizontal axis, and between the values mu minus sigma and mu plus three sigma is shaded.

From left to right, the value at the second tickmark is labeled mu minus two sigma, the value at the fourth tickmark is labeled mu, and the value at the fifth tickmark is labeled mu plus sigma. The area below the graph of the curve, above the horizontal axis, and between the values mu minus two sigma and mu plus sigma is shaded.

From left to right, a value between the third and the fourth tickmarks is labeled mu minus 0.55 sigma, the value at the fourth tickmark is labeled mu, and a value between the fifth and the sixth tickmarks is labeled mu plus 1.3 sigma. The area below the graph of the curve, above the horizontal axis, and between the values mu minus 0.55 sigma and mu plus 1.3 sigma is shaded.

From left to right, the value at the fourth tickmark is labeled mu, a value between the fourth and the fifth tickmarks is labeled mu plus 0.55 sigma, and a value between the fifth and the sixth tickmarks is labeled mu plus 1.3 sigma. The area below the graph of the curve, above the horizontal axis, and between the values mu plus 0.55 sigma and mu plus 1.3 sigma is shaded.

content.answer: From left to right, the value at the third tickmark is labeled mu minus sigma, the value at the fourth tickmark is labeled mu, and the value at the sixth tickmark is labeled mu plus two sigma. The area below the graph of the curve, above the horizontal axis, and between the values mu minus sigma and mu plus two sigma is shaded.

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Compare distributions or relative positions of points within a distribution.
